intro: Astracantha arnacantha subsp. arnacanthoides, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic to mammals. The plant features erect, branching stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central corona. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
